title: Patrick Carrigan
text:
Patrick Carrigan (born 1 January 1998) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>
Background.
Carrigan was born in <a href="Brisbane%2C%20Queensland%2C%20Australia">Brisbane</a>, Queensland, Australia. He attended <a href="St%20Joseph%27s%20College%2C%20Gregory%20Terrace">St Joseph’s College, Gregory Terrace</a> in Brisbane and was the School Captain in 2015. He played Rugby Union and was Captain of the 1st XV School Rugby Team.
Carrigan has played for the following clubs: East Tigers Junior Club, Wynnum Manly, Brisbane Broncos (20s), East Tigers, and the Brisbane Broncos.
UQ Bachelor of Physiotherapy (Honours) student, he received a UQ Blue sporting honour in 2019, only the third Rugby League player to win this award since 1912.
Playing career.
Carrigan played for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in the under 20s Holden Cup competition from 2016 to 2018, being named in the 2017 <a href="NYC">NYC</a> team of the year on the bench. In round 5, 2019 Carrigan made his <a href="NRL">NRL</a> debut for Brisbane against the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>. Carrigan was the co-captain of Brisbane for the start of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a> with <a href="Brodie%20Croft">Brodie Croft</a>.
Carrigan made 19 appearances for Brisbane captaining in 12 of those games in the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a> as the club finished last on the table and claimed the wooden spoon for the first time in their history. Even with a poor season at club land Carrigan performed very well and was selected in the extended 27 man squad for <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> in the State of Origin in November.
In round 9 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Carrigan suffered a season ending ACL injury during Brisbane's 19-18 loss against arch-rivals <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland</a>.
